page.title: 08FARMING HOMELIFE AT WILLEY
page.content: Willey Lodge is a picturesque 15C house in an idyllic setting of 162 acres. The house has been modified over the centuries, the present house incorporating one time outbuildings, stock quarters and cheese room. Cattle are Hereford bull, Freesian cows. Sheep are North Country with a Suffolk ram for fat sheep rearing. The present farmer aims to be self sufficient but needs to rent extra summer grazing. Stock has been doubled over the family's 16 years ownership through employment of intensive farm methods. Husband and wife are of farming stock but not from Willey area. The children have interests in sports, music, scouts, church, & Young Farmers which require chauffeuring them to Ludlow. The parents belong to the church,W.I and attend evening classes.
